Putting it all together: the steps for translation.

1. Read n.

square = n*n

2. Compute loop = n (since square div n is n).

div = loop /2 → integer division.

3. Allocate odd and even arrays.

number_odds = (square +1)/2

number_evens = square / 2 

allocate odd(1:number_odds)

allocate even(1:number_evens)

4. Fill the arrays:

count_odd =0, count_even=0

do i =1, square

    if MOD(i,2) ==1 then

        count_odd=count_odd +1

        odd(count_odd) = i

    else

        count_even=count_even +1

        even(count_even)=i

    end if

end do

5. Now set the pointers:

front_odd =1

back_odd = number_odds

front_even=1

back_even = number_evens

6. Now the loops:

do i=1, loop 

    do j=1, div 

        if MOD(i,2) ==1 then

            ! first take front_odd and advance front_odd

            ! get number off_odd = odd(front_odd)

            num1 = odd(front_odd)

            front_odd = front_odd +1

            ! then take the even array's back_even element and decrement

            num2 = even(back_even)

            back_even = back_even -1

        else

            ! when i even:

            num1 = even(front_even)

            front_even = front_even +1 

            ! second is the odd's back_odd:

            num2 = odd(back_odd)

            back_odd = back_odd -1

        end if

        ! print num1 and num2, separated by a space

        write(*, '(i0,1x,i0)', advance=no) num1, num2

    end do

    write(*,*) ! new line

end do

program codeforces_334_A

   implicit none

   integer :: n, square, loop, div

   integer, allocatable :: odd(:), even(:)

   integer :: i, j

   integer :: front_odd, back_odd, front_even, back_even

   integer :: count_odd, count_even, num1, num2

   ! read n

   read(*,*) n

   square = n * n

   loop = n

   div = loop / 2

   ! compute number of odds and evens

   count_odds = (square + 1) / 2

   count_evens = square / 2

   allocate (odd(1:count_odds))

   allocate (even(1:count_evens))

   count_odd =0

   count_even =0

   ! fill the arrays

   do i=1, square

      if (mod(i,2) == 1) then

         count_odd = count_odd +1

         odd(count_odd) = i

      else

         count_even = count_even +1

         even(count_even)=i

      end if

   end do

   ! initialize pointers

   front_odd =1

   back_odd = count_odds

   front_even =1

   back_even = count_evens

   ! loop through rows

   do i=1, loop ! rows are loop =n (since loop is n)

      do j=1, div

         if (mod(i,2)==1) then

            ! i odd

            num1 = odd(front_odd)

            front_odd = front_odd +1

            num2 = even(back_even)

            back_even = back_even -1

         else

            ! i is even

            num1 = even(front_even)

            front_even = front_even +1

            num2 = odd(back_odd)

            back_odd = back_odd -1

         end if

         ! Write the two numbers with a space, without a newline

         write(*, '(i0,i0)', advance='no') num1, ' ', num2

         ! Alternative approach:

         write(*, '(i0,1x,i0)', advance='no') num1, num2

      end do

      ! after the j loop, print new line

      write(*, *)

   end do

   deallocate(odd, even)

end program codeforces_334_A
